html:
December 10 (IFR) - UK software company Aveva Group reported take-up of 99.1% on its fully underwritten £2.835bn rights issue to part-finance its US$5bn acquisition of SoftBank-backed OSIsoft.

The rump of 1.1m was placed in the market on Thursday morning at £32.85 each, more or less flat to Wednesday's close of £32.84.

Rights issue pricing was £22.55, a 32.2% discount to TERP of £33.28, with a total of 125.7m shares on offer on a 7-for-9 basis.

JP Morgan and Numis were global coordinators, with Barclays and BNP Paribas as bookrunners and Santander as lead manager.

Aveva announced its plan to acquire OSIsoft in late August. OSIsoft makes software that captures data from ships, chemical boilers, power plants and other facilities in industries, including oil and gas, mining, pulp and paper, and water.

Shares in Aveva were fairly stable on Thursday, and by 3:30pm in London they were down 0.4% at £32.71. 

(Reporting by Lucy Raitano; editing by Ian Edmondson)

((lucy.raitano@refinitiv.com))
